intro: Peponia lagenarioides, commonly known as the bottle gourd or calabash, is a flowering plant in the Cucurbitaceae family. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas and is characterized by its large, bottle-shaped fruits. The plant has heart-shaped leaves and produces yellow flowers that develop into the distinctive gourd fruits. It is often cultivated for its edible young fruits and has been used historically for making containers and utensils. The plant thrives in warm climates and requires well-drained soil for optimal growth.
